fields.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

The integration ID used to reference the Payroll Input.  If the ID for the Payroll Input is found, the web service will update the existing data.  Otherwise, a new Payroll Input instance  will be created.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

A non-unique code used by some Payroll Interface customers.  External Payroll Code is available in Workday 13 if the customer has enabled it via the Tenant Setup page.

Batch ID can be assigned to a set of Payroll Inputs to enable the external system to manage Payroll Input data by Batch ID.  There are transactions in Workday Payroll that let the user maintain Payroll Input data by Batch ID (Payroll Input by Batch ID and Delete Payroll Input by Batch ID).
Start Date (e.g. the date on which the Payroll Input commences)
End Date (e.g. the date on which the Payroll Input ends, if applicable)

Batch_ID.description: Batch ID can be assigned to a set of Payroll Inputs to enable the external system to manage Payroll Input data by Batch ID.  There are transactions in Workday Payroll that let the user maintain Payroll Input data by Batch ID (Payroll Input by Batch ID and Delete Payroll Input by Batch ID).
